newsitem.title: CHINA: Nippon Carbide opens China sheeting plant.
newsitem.headline: Nippon Carbide opens China sheeting plant.

text.p: Japan's Nippon Carbide Industries Co Inc has officially started up a $74.6 million reflective sheeting plant in China's eastern province of Zhejiang, the China Daily said on Monday.

The new factory in the Xiaoshan Economic and Technological Development Zone near the provincial capital of Hangzhou would produce 5.0 million square metres (53.8 million square ft) of retro-reflective sheeting and 700,000 square metres (7.5 million square ft) of high intensity retro-reflective sheeting a year, it said.
About 70 percent of the plant's output would be exported to the United States and southeast Asia while 30 percent would be sold within China, it said.
Retro-reflective sheeting is used in making licence plates and highway, railway, port and construction signs.
Demand for retro-reflective sheeting in China was estimated to be about 4.0 million square metres (43 million square ft) a year, a market second only to the United States, it said.
The plant has registered capital of $62 million, the newspaper said.
